experience.title: experience
experience.description:
I've been developing for about 3 years. I also spent a lot of time freelancing. The relatively quick turnover of projects I worked on allowed me to understand many technologies and significantly expand my skill set.

In the last year, I have also taken on team lead responsibilities: planning tasks, reviewing code, mentoring junior developers and making architectural decisions to keep the development process consistent and efficient.

hard-skills.title: hard-skills
hard-skills.description:
As a front-end developer, I must know basic website design tools such as Figma, HTML5 and CSS3.

Besides website design, I know javascript and its two most popular frameworks (in fact, one of the most popular frameworks and the most popular library): React (along with Next.js) and VueJS (along with Nuxt.js).

For typing (which I think is necessary) I use TypeScript.

Everyone knows about the benefits of state managers, including me, so I learned more than one: Redux, TanStack, Zustand, MobX.

In addition to browser javascript, I have a good understanding of the server side: I know Express.js and NestJS.

Among other skills, I can highlight knowledge of Python, Git, SQL and MongoDB, build tools and package manager (for example, Webpack, npm, Yarn), understanding of client-server interaction (WebSocket, REST).

soft-skills.title: soft-skills
soft-skills.description:
My strength is critical thinking. It is this skill that helps me quickly and accurately analyze and filter information, which results in a high learning speed.

I consider time management skills to be an equally important feature of any developer. They are the ones who turn an amateur into a specialist ready to work in a team. Time management is a separate science that I study every day.

Another nice skill that is especially important for employers and that I possess is the ability to listen to the customer. This allows the business to save time discussing the same problem for the tenth time and concentrate on the tasks at hand.

Additionally, I have team leadership experience: coordinating developers, maintaining a healthy workflow, helping with technical decisions, and mentoring less experienced teammates.

bio.title: bio
bio.description:
About me
Hello, my name is Vladislav. I'm 23 years old and from Kazakhstan. I've been studying web development since school. It all started with some video on YouTube about website design. I actively started learning html, and after that css.

After a long break, I started learning Javascript and soon received my first order — thus began a period of commercial development that continues to this day (1.5 years). Over this time, I’ve worked on many projects in different teams, and more recently I’ve also taken on team lead responsibilities such as code reviewing, mentoring and helping guide technical decisions.

interests.title: interests
interests.description:
I am constantly learning something new, and in my free time I try to improve on what I already know.

In addition to development, I am interested in music. I not only listen to it, but also reproduce it with my guitar, and also try to create my own. I am a laureate of many republican guitar playing competitions

education.title: education
education.description:
I have always been passionate about technology and design, which led me to pursue a career as a frontend developer. My education laid a strong foundation in computer science, programming, and user interface design. Through both formal studies and self-driven learning, I have gained expertise in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and modern frontend frameworks.

I continuously enhance my knowledge by completing online courses (you can take a look at my certificates to see for yourself), attending workshops, and staying up to date with the latest industry trends. This commitment to lifelong learning ensures that I deliver clean, responsive, and user-friendly interfaces that meet the demands of today’s digital landscape.

files.high-school:
In high school, I tried to disengage from studying subjects that I did not consider most important for my future career. This allowed me to delve deeper into areas of interest to me, including web development.

However, I always studied well and never had grades lower than 4 (on a five-point scale).
files.university:
I studied at the First St. Petersburg State Medical University named after Pavlov, majoring in pediatrics. Two years later, I realized that medicine was not interesting to me and took up programming in depth.

Currently I am studying at Astana IT University, majoring in Big Data Analysis, where I actively participate in the educational process.

sports.title: sports
sports.description: I am an avid sports fan. My favorite sport is definitely chess, which I have been doing since I was 6 years old. However, sports should maintain not only a person’s intellect, but also their physical condition in good health. Realizing this, I constantly discover new directions for myself - from basketball to boxing.

favorite-games.title: favorite-games
favorite-games.description:
I love games, especially those that are competitive and show your skill (that's why I chose chess as a child). Usually these are games that have a rating system: Dota 2 and Counter-Strike 2.

In my opinion, every person should control the time he spends on such entertainment. It is thanks to proper time management that I find a balance between learning and leisure.

1.title: _telegram_content_aggregator
1.description: A web-based tool that aggregates and presents Telegram channel content in a slider-style interface.

2.title: _product_aggregator
2.description: A web platform that aggregates publicly available product listings from marketplace and enables delivery to regions not supported by the original one.

3.title: _chess-game
3.description: Chess, with the ability to play alone or against the computer, as well as solve random chess problems.

4.title: _amazoom
4.description: A simple online hardware store. My introduction to NextJS happened there.

5.title: _color_manager
5.description: Website for color selection using vanilla javascript.

6.title: _portfolio
6.description: Exactly the website you are on right now.

7.title: _it-school-website
7.description: Fullstack web application for a real IT school.
